comments.body: YEAH! the code is already in game, mojang needs to implement it!
it would be so helpful to be able to open the shulker box while in the inventory.

They are not going to do this, the reason why (and I agree) is because bundles will become obsolete entirely because shulker boxes have a full amount of storage, I think an enchantment for bundles that increases slot-storage capacity (adding a slot per enchantment level) up to like 6 or 7 slots would still keep people using bundles but also shulker boxes.

Shulker boxes are already really good and they are rebalanced by difficulty of getting them and by there necessity to being placed. (I am not sure about this, but I believe shulkers cannot be stored in shulkers, while bundles can store other bundles making more of a balance between them.)
This issue with this idea (I documented it more here) is the creaking doesn't have a specific "death".
I agree, such conditions should be the same for all trees. Plus itâ€™d be easier to find pale gardens.
If not a new block then the Creaking Heart could have the fog. Any way I'd love to how a movable fog
I love the idea of a block providing the effect! Could work for creative maps!
This should include a pet ender dragon (hatched from the dragon egg).
I'd love to be able to put a saddle on a spider and ride it up cliffs. Even if it was still hostile to me when I wasn't riding it, I think that would be amazing.
I WANT ILLUSIONERS BACK!!!!!!
Oh defintely theres already a new texture for it in dungeons so maybe they could take it from there.
perfect addition to the new update. They need something like this
YES MCD ILLUSIONER YESSSSS
what if their are rear baches of burned trees in oak, tiger, snowy bioms and more even burned leaves or leave litter even or even ash piles.

that's a great idea! 
the wood would have to withstand lava and not burn. on the other hand, it's very easy to break and gives 1/20 chance of giving an effect for 8 seconds, making the player cough and partially close his eyes as if he had smoke and dust in his eyes. our speed would also be reduced by 10%.

i guess it doesn't fit 100% with the idea that you can craft the creaking heart with resin, due to how it instantly would turn into amber, but their could be a magical explanation to that so im not too worried.
Even simply addding a sort of non-brick resin block that can be found under the trees could be neat.
pour le gros arbre plutot 1 boss
Lakes are so cool in general as a clearing, so a lake clearing feature could really make the garden special. I'd also prefer making this a centerpiece much more than a cemetary.
They could make it so if you name the creaking heart, any creaking spawned by it has the same name.

(continued)

The mace is a wonderful weapon that revolutionized PvP and PvE, when maces and wind charges are involved fighters must be constantly on their toes making sure the other player doesn't get the drop on them (literally). And when fighting monsters it offers a new and safer (if you know what you're doing) way to kill them, while also having a lot of fun. The sickle would also offer a whole new strategy when it comes to fights.

PvP, the Sickle would become a surprise attack weapon, you sneak up too your opponents from behind, and than with one hit you gain a massive health advantage, or maybe kill them if they were already damaged. The Sickle would also force players too be more weary during open matches, if your opponent just manages to get behind you than you might be dead.

PvE, getting behind monsters can be tough, so using a sickle on one would require more strategy. The mace requires wind charges too be really effective, the Sickle would require that you either distract the monster with another mob (like a dog), trap them in cobwebs, or put a pumpkin on their head.

It's important that the creaking core is dropped only from naturally generated hearts, so that you have to explore the pale gardens and fight the Creaking. Otherwise you can get around them.

The sickle would have a 3 second cold down between attacks, too avoid dealing 24 or 36 damage in one second, or getting a lucky back hit simply by spamming.
I genuinely like this. A lot.

The sickle isn't better at hacking at crops/8-year-olds-on-cracked-accs than your kitchen knife. What I would like to try is a weapon that deals massive sweeping damage, especially against mobs.

P.S. The surprise-attack mechanic is unusable in PvE, given that monsters detect and face you from range. I can see some use if you are intervening in another player's fight, but there oughta be some better use in singleplayer.

First, you're right, sickles are not any better at surprise attacks than a kitchen knife, in fact sickles are not designed as weapons. But Minecraft focuses on peoples perception and imagination instead of reality. Take the mace for example, in real life the idea that you should jump from a high place and land a crushing blow on an opponent is ridicules, it makes no sense. And why choose a mace? A hammer would have been much more understandable and simple. But Minecraft doesn't worry about this, it appeals to the imagination. What do we do with a heavy weapon? We slam people with it. And so the awesome/absurd idea of a slam attack was created. Minecraft also likes to choose more obscure items, this makes it feel more interesting and uniquely Minecraft. Thus, mace instead of hammer. Also, the mace's appearance is purely imaginary and fun, not like a real mace in any way.

The sickle would be a cool weapon, its outlandish and unexpected, but so was the mace.

It is true, using this weapon in PvE is hard, maybe even to the point where it's unpractical, but the same is true of the mace. Without wind charges the mace is a tough weapon to use effectively, not to mention that if your timing is off you'll take fall damage and most likely get hit by the enemy. But I think the sickle is still useable, it may be harder, but there's also much less punishment for failure. Here are some ways players can use it on enemies.

(continued)

1. Craved Pumpkin; I didn't specify this in the post (pardon me) but when wearing a pumpkin mobs do not count as "seeing you", so when fighting a zombie you can drop a carved pumpkin for him to wear, than land a critical hit on him. This may seem overly complicated, it would be easier to use a sword, but the same is true for the mace. This would be more useful on mobs like piglin brutes.

2. Distraction; during many fights mobs will target your dogs instead of you, and many times skeletons will get into fights with other monsters, in these situations you can easily maneuver yourself behind an enemy. This can also be done with villagers and golems. However, this would be super easy in multiplayer, mobs can only target one player at a time, so the other player can get behind them.

3. Invisibility; invisibility makes it much harder for mobs to notice you, especially if you're not wearing any armor, this makes it possible to maneuver around them. This fits the ninja vibe the weapon gives.

4. Not so much a technique, but there are many mobs that are not naturally hostile, these mobs you can get around to their backs. It's easy to get behind an enderman or piglin, and the sickle should be strong enough to oneshot these enemies. Guardians can't sense you unless they see you directly so it works on them. Enchant the sickle to make it more powerful and maybe you could one shot an iron golem. The warden doesn't auto track the player so you can get behind it and hit it (if your daring).

Just like the mace, the sickle is a highly situational weapon, the mace requires high ground or wind charges, the sickle requires some way to stop your opponents from looking at you, this can be done with a carved pumpkin, invisibility potion, or a  distraction.

 

In case I was confusing, mobs with carved pumpkins still auto track the player, but just like how the creaking doesn't pause when a player wearing a carved pumpkin looks at it, the sickle works on enemies with a carved pumpkin.

 

I'm also aware that the chances this gets added are incredibly slim now that the game drop is fleshed out, I don't see any more changes coming. However I still want this weapon implemented at some point, even if it's no longer directly related to the creaking and pale garden, so I hope people will still vote for the idea. Thank you!
cool

P.S. The surprise-attack mechanic is unusable in PvE, given that monsters detect and face you from range. I can see some use if you are intervening in another player's fight, but there oughta be some better use in singleplayer.

Agreed, but the boss should be bigger than a normal illager. Maybe it could be an illager riding a ravager (substituting the axe for horns. The illager riding it does the spellcasting).

I also think that it shouldn't be able to one-hit the player, that's just too powerful. (Maybe two-hit, or one-hit if the player isn't wearing any armor.)

The block that adds it to a raid could be a portrait of the guy. If its placed anywhere in the village, then any raid that triggers only has two waves, with the boss coming in the second.

Instead of riding a ravager, they could ride a new flying mob. Players could try and kill the flying mob to ground the boss. This would keep it from being as cheese-able, at least at first. The boss could summon more of the flying mob while it is airborne, and use your axe rush attack once its grounded.

The first wave could introduce the flying mobs to the players, maybe with pillagers riding some. They'd be only slightly larger than phantoms.
How would summoning these "corrupted" vexes be any different from normal vexes?
If have more acient structure the sniffer may find it for you (for sotp to every one think that sniffer is useless)
yes they are useless
I think this would be great, maybe it could even be a way to finally let players locate ancient cities without having to guess where they are.

I suspect that there is indeed hope for this, Mojang recently said they have a lot planned for the Illagers, hinting that they will be updated. And I think bringing back the iceologer would get people really excited. I also suspect that the Moobloom would come with it because that would bring all the mobs from one of the most controversial updates, which would make the community go nuts.

I think the Ice Revenant should have a unique weapon to make it stand out among the crowd of hostile mobs. I'm thinking a magical icy spear that it can thrown repeatedly like a drowned with a trident. It wouldn't be affected by gravity however it would phase out after about 30 blocks. When it hits you I reckon, it does one heart of damage and then five seconds of freezing damage (like powdered snow.) Depending on the situation it's implemented, I would say the weapon could be added to the game as a drop for the mob.
Thanks for the positive feedback! If this post hits 20 votes, I'll make one for the mushroom island!

The Iceologer would be a fantastic addition, and would certainly distract people from the glow squid (I rather dislike that mob). However, the Iceologer would be frustrating and difficult for a new player who  makes a new world and encounters one in an ice spikes or snowy plains biome. Maybe there could be a specific structure, like an Ice Palace or Ice Fortress, in which they would dwell?
Two until the mushroom island! I've already prepared my post, & will release it as soon as I get that beautiful 20! Hope you like golems! *foreshadowing*
I think that the Iceologer should spawn in an ice tower, & should also spawn in an ice palace, where a new frozen boss will dwell. I'm imagining something like an Illager wraith, ghostly & pale.

I've designed a weapon related to the Ice Revenant! Behold, the Frostblade!

The Frostblade is a claymore inspired weapon, sharp & powerful. When used, it will inflict slowness upon the victim. It has a long, icy edge. If you hold "interact," it will begin to charge. If you charge enough & release, it will release a crescent of frost, inflicting heavy slowness upon all those who touch it. It lasts 3 seconds. The blade alone does a point more damage than a diamond sword, & the crescent does 4. It is used by some of the Revenants in combat, & has extreme durability. It can be fixed using frost shards, dropped by Revenants.

I'll let you, the community, vote for my next post. The one that gets most upvoted before New Year (I'll post an intro for each) wins, & will be my next post. Only one can remain. Here are the Candidates!

  1. Mushroom Islands & a Strange new Island Biome
  2. Deserts & a Secret Beneath the Sand
  3. A New Realm of the Skies, Serene & Dangerous

Choose one, & vote quickly!

-The Writer

The Desert update (intro)

The Deserts are rather boring, with nothing but cactus & sand as far as the eye can see. I seek to change that using an overhaul of its current features, along with adding some new ones. I'd also like to include those found in the biome vote. So, here's my intro idea!

The deserts of Minecraft are rather plain, but the ones of Minecraft Dungeons are the opposite. They have new trees, new structures, &... sand layers? I think that Minecraft should give sand some of the variants snow has, mainly sand layers. This would add a better landscape to the biome. It could generate during sandstorms, a new weather type only available in the desert. When a player is inside a sandstorm cloud, they will be damaged over time.

Another Idea I had was a hidden dungeon beneath the sand, including a new weapon; the Glaive. It has a farther reach, & deals heavy damage if used from behind. Use the new enchantment "poison edge" to make it inflict poison upon use.

The Sklands Dimension (Intro)

I'm sure we've all heard of the Aether, an awesome dimension that seems the opposite of the Nether. Well I took inspiration from it & made my own! Presenting, the Skylands!

My first feature I thought of is of course a way to get there. You cannot get there by portal, but by flying above the height limit. It should be at least a hundred blocks above, in case the height limit is altered in a future update. In this new dimension, there are new lush biomes, & powerful ores. Starstone can be found at the bottom of every island, & no stars can be seen in the sky, adding to the lore of the game. Starstone can be smelted into 3 ingots at a time, & crafted into diamond level armor that grants you speed, jump boost, & slow falling when the full set is worn. Can only be mined with a diamond pickaxe. The Clouds can be seen beneath this dimension's skybox.

My idea keeps getting rejected to the community. Not sure why. It was epic if you ask me. Well, I guess I'll think of something else! By the way, my account switched somehow today. I'll be TheChieftan9442 from now on!

If it were to be part of trade rebalance update, Swamp huts would have an item frame containing the Swamp Scroll. Finally, in a chest of a jungle pyramid, there would also be the Jungle Scroll. The six would be required to craft the "ultimate scroll", but since it's harder, you get more emeralds.
QUESTION: What would this scroll DO? It has to have a use.

{reply to question} It can be traded to cartographers for high amount of emerald/give hero of the village effect or idk. I think they should also be placed in chiseled bookshelves for a better decoration :). Idk anything else you may suggest a use.
What if they could be used to craft the maps sold by cartgraphers... say your traveling in a woodland mansion and find a trial chamber scroll. Then, you can use it to find a trial chamber!
They also could maybe be used to find rare biomes like mushroom fields, deep dark etc. (like how players can currently trade with villagers to get maps that lead to structures that are hard to find).
I like it. Maybe in exchange for a scroll, you could get an explorer map to a structure you usually can't map too, like an ancient city. Good idea!
What about the penguin? Would have rather taken that over the armadillo, since the penguin provides better use :)

Sounds great. I'd love more variation in how the world behaves, currently the only use for the moonphase is slime spawning. It doesn't need to be so limited. Good suggestion!
already exists, I think

Part of it could effect certain mob spawn rates. Witches could spawn more on phases closer to a new moon, with none spawning on any phase more full than half-full. In exchange for fewer witches, the phases closer to a full moon could cause more mobs to spawn as babies (either zombies spawn more frequently as babies or more types of mobs like skeletons and spiders, or even creepers, spawn as babies).

It would add variation to nighttime PvE beyond phantoms -- like you said, a layer of depth and interaction.
Okay, listen. I get that this would be pretty neat, but think about it. How would the Minecraft creators implement it? I
Either that, or a decrepit house with a walled garden with the walls broken.
Good, but no potion please.

My flower idea is the pale blossom, it only generates at night to give players a reason to explore when the creaking is out, and it generates a sort of fog effect around it. Imagine being able to add fog to any build! (I made a post about this called the Pale Blossom- Fog Emitting Plant if you want too see more).

A magic themed structure for this biome would be cool because it could fit the theme of enchanting and hold some items that could fix some problems in enchanting, like how you can't remove curses. Great idea!
